Package Scheduler.Controllers

Class CustomerController

  • java.lang.Object
    • Scheduler.Controllers.CustomerController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AddCustomerController, UpdateCustomerController
    public abstract class CustomerController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    Abstract controller class for customer input forms, handling setting common UI and button handlers.
    Author:
    Chris Criswell

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void onCancel​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Cancel button handler that prompts cancel confirmation and closes current window Two lambda expressions are used in conjunction with method chaining to provide a single line of code to control the flow of the generated event.
      void onFinish​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Method to perform further operations after onSave and onCancel handlers are called; currently simply closes the window
      (package private) abstract boolean onSave​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Abstract save button handler
      void setCommonUI()
      Initializes UI components common to all customer forms, including setting country and division combo boxes A lambda expression makes the setOnAction() method call for the countryComboBox more readable and easy-to-follow by by-passing the full instantiation of an EventHandler object and not having to provide an override of the handle() method.
      void setHandlers()
      Sets button handlers common to all customer forms Lambda expressions are used with the setOnAction() method to bypass instantiating a EventHandler class and overriding a handle method.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • Methods inherited from interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

        initialize

    • Method Detail

      • onSave

        abstract boolean onSave​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Abstract save button handler
        Parameters:
        event - button click event
        Returns:
        bool indicating success of save operation

      • onCancel

        public void onCancel​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Cancel button handler that prompts cancel confirmation and closes current window Two lambda expressions are used in conjunction with method chaining to provide a single line of code to control the flow of the generated event. Specifically, the lambdas provide a shorthand way to show the predicate function of the filter() function, which filters for which buttons the user presses on the alert box, and the ifPresent() uses a lambda expression to show concisely that the propagation of the event should not be passed on through the application. https://stackoverflow.com/questions/41233886/display-a-confirmation-dialogue-when-the-user-try-to-exit-the-application-press
        Parameters:
        event - button click event

      • onFinish

        public void onFinish​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Method to perform further operations after onSave and onCancel handlers are called; currently simply closes the window
        Parameters:
        event - button click event

      • setCommonUI

        public void setCommonUI()
        Initializes UI components common to all customer forms, including setting country and division combo boxes A lambda expression makes the setOnAction() method call for the countryComboBox more readable and easy-to-follow by by-passing the full instantiation of an EventHandler object and not having to provide an override of the handle() method.

      • setHandlers

        public void setHandlers()
        Sets button handlers common to all customer forms Lambda expressions are used with the setOnAction() method to bypass instantiating a EventHandler class and overriding a handle method.
